question: In the reaction sequence:
Aniline <katex>$\xrightarrow{Reagent 1} C_6H_5N_2Cl \xrightarrow{Reagent 2} P \xrightarrow{Reagent 3} C_6H_5NO_2$</katex>
Reagents 1, 2, and 3 corresponding to P, Q, R steps in the diagram are:
explanation: The conversion of aniline to diazonium salt uses <katex>$NaNO_2/HCl$</katex>. The diazonium salt reacts with <katex>$HBF_4$</katex> to form the fluoroborate precipitate (P). Heating this with <katex>$NaNO_2$</katex> in the presence of Cu forms Nitrobenzene.
